polycleaver.core package¶

Submodules¶

polycleaver.core.miscellaneous module¶

polycleaver.core.miscellaneous.load_bar(index, total)[source]¶

polycleaver.core.mnx module¶

class polycleaver.core.mnx.BulkUnit(bulk)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class analyses the parameters of a monometallic ionic-covalent bulk structure (i.e., Mg2SiO4, CaCO3) based on geometrical and oxidation state data.

property anions¶

Define the anions in the structure, by detecting whether negative oxidation states are present.

Raises:

ValueError – if no anions are found in the structure.

Returns:

PeriodicSite objects of all anions.

Return type:

(list)

property cations¶

Define the metallic cation by determining species with positive oxidation states not matching centers’ species.

Raises:

ValueError – if no cations are found in the structure.

Returns:

PeriodicSite objects of all cations.

Return type:

(list)

property centers¶

Define the anion centers in the structure. These are detected by obtaining the nearest neighbours to the anion species.

Raises:

ValueError – if no polyatomic anions are found in the structure.

Returns:

PeriodicSite objects of all covalent anionic unit centers.

Return type:

(list)

class polycleaver.core.mnx.SlabUnit(slab, bulk_obj)[source]¶

Bases: BulkUnit

Inherited BulkUnit class, adapted for the generated slabs. Adds additional parameters, as well as analysis functions to perform stoichiometry and polarity corrections.

bottom_site(element)[source]¶

Finds the bottom site of a slab. :param element: element of site to be investigated, as string (e.g., ‘Fe’).

property clusters_to_remove¶

Detects undercoordinated anionic centers and retrieves their nearest neighbors. :returns: PeriodicSite objects of undercoordinated anionic centers,

as well as their nearest anion neighbors.

Return type:

(list)

depolarize_anions()[source]¶

Removes polyatomic anions from one side or the other from a structure without cations until non-polarity is achieved. In addition, returns approach value. By default, polyatomic anion clusters are removed from the top; if non-polarity cannot be achieved through this method, the structure is regenerated and the algorithm repeats from the bottom, changing ‘approach_value’ to ‘bot’. :returns: side from which polyatomic anions have been removed,

which determines the side from which cations should be removed in subsequent geometrical operations to achieve non-polarity of the whole structure.

Return type:

(str)

depolarize_cations(topbot=None)[source]¶

Once non-polarity is achieved in the scaffold containing only polyatomic anions, cations are removed from one side, as determined by the ‘topbot’ parameter, until non-polarity is achieved (or until bulk stroichiometry is achieved in the slab). :param topbot: side from which polyatomic anions have been removed.

property lone_anions¶

Analyses the structure to find the anions which are not bound todo their center atom (e.g., in the case of silicates, O atoms which are not bound to Si). :returns: PeriodicSite objects of lone anions. :rtype: (list)

remove_element(elements)[source]¶

Similarly to the ‘remove_sites’ function, this function removes all sites of a certain element. :param element: element to be removed, as string (e.g., ‘Fe’).

remove_sites(sites)[source]¶

Wrapping of the remove_sites function of pymatgen, this function removes a set of sites inside the SlabUnit class, without generating a copy of the structure and maintaining site attributes. :param sites: list of PeriodicSite objects of sites which are to be :param removed from the main SlabUnit object.:

stoichiometrize()[source]¶

Removes cations from a non-polar slab until composition matches the bulk stoichiometry.

there_are_cations()[source]¶
property thickness¶

Determines the thickness of the slab based on the maximum and minimum Z cartesian positions of all atoms. :returns: thickness of the slab in angstroms. :rtype: (float)

top_site(element)[source]¶

Finds the top site of a slab. :param element: element of site to be investigated, as string (e.g., ‘Fe’).

undercoordinated_sites(sites)[source]¶

Retrieves number of undercoordinated sites of a surface. The coordination number of the saturated site is defined as the maximum coordination number of all the sites in the list; therefore, this function is to be used with all species of one type in the structure at the same time (by calling the ‘centers/anions/cations’ functions in the BulkUnit and SlabUnit classes) :param sites: list of PeriodicSite objects to investigate.

Returns:

number of undercoordinated sites.

Return type:

(int)

polycleaver.core.mnx.generate_mnx_slabs(bulk_str, hkl, thickness=15, vacuum=15, save=True)[source]¶

Generates non-polar, stoichiometric slabs from a given bulk and set of miller indices. In addition, polyatomic anion clusters, which are bound covalently, are preserved. This is achieved by:

  1. Generating a set of polar and non-polar surfaces using pymatgen’s SlabGenerator class.

  2. Attempts to Tasker-correct the slabs to achieve non-polarity, using pymatgen’s get_tasker2_slabs function. This often finds more non-polar slabs.

  3. Orthogonalises the slabs.

  4. Corrects the slab to achieve non-polarity and bulk stoichiometry: i. Removes lone anions which have been stripped from their atomic

    center.

    1. Since polarity is determined by the polyatomic anion distribution as it is the main non-divisible unit, a scaffold wherein all cations have been removed is generated.

    2. Non-polarity is achieved in the scaffold containing polyatomic anions.

    3. Non-polar scaffold is populated with the cations that were removed.

    4. Non-polarity is achieved in the structure by selectively removing cations from one or the other side.

    5. Fractional composition of the slab is made to match that of the bulk by removing equivalent cations from both sides of the slab, while attempting to keep non-polarity.

Parameters:

  • bulk – pymatgen.core.structure.Structure object of the bulk of which slabs are to be generated.

  • hkl – list of Miller indices as tuples (e.g., [(0,0,1), (0,1,0)]) of planes parallel to surfaces to generate. Alternatively, maximum integer of the Miller index to analyse (e.g., if hkl=1, all symmetrically distinct Miller indices up to (1,1,1) will be considered, as determined by pymatgen’s ‘get_symmetrically_distinct_miller_indices’ function).

  • thickness – thickness of the preliminary slabs generated. Note that this thickness will certainly vary in the final, corrected slabs.

  • vacuum – vacuum of the preliminary slabs in the direction normal to the surface. Note that this thickness will certainly vary in the final, corrected slabs.

Returns:

SlabUnit objects of corrected slabs with all required parameters

for characterisation.

Return type:

(list)

polycleaver.core.mx module¶

polycleaver.core.mx.generate_mx_slabs(bulk_str, hkl, thickness=15, vacuum=15, save=True)[source]¶

Generates non-polar, stoichiometric slabs from a given ionic crystal

Parameters:

  • bulk – pymatgen.core.structure.Structure object of the bulk of which slabs are to be generated.

  • hkl – list of Miller indices as tuples (e.g., [(0,0,1), (0,1,0)]) of planes parallel to surfaces to generate. Alternatively, maximum integer of the Miller index to analyse (e.g., if hkl=1, all symmetrically distinct Miller indices up to (1,1,1) will be considered, as determined by pymatgen’s ‘get_symmetrically_distinct_miller_indices’ function).

  • thickness – thickness of the preliminary slabs generated. Note that this thickness will certainly vary in the final, corrected slabs.

  • vacuum – vacuum of the preliminary slabs in the direction normal to the surface. Note that this thickness will certainly vary in the final, corrected slabs.

Returns:

SlabUnit objects of corrected slabs with all required parameters

for characterisation.

Return type:

(list)

polycleaver.core.tools module¶

polycleaver.core.tools.get_hkl_list(hkl)[source]¶

Generates list of Miller indices based on hkl input. If hkl is integer n, generates list of non-equivalent hkl indices so that h, k, l < n; if hkl is a list of tuples, returns the same list as the indices input.

Parameters:

hkl – integer or tuple list of miller indices.

polycleaver.core.tools.get_initial_slabs(bulk, hkl, thickness, vacuum, tolerance=0.01)[source]¶

Desc.

polycleaver.core.tools.get_preliminary_slabs(bulk, hkl_list, thickness, vacuum, tolerance, center_slab=True)[source]¶

Generates preliminary slabs and corrects them if possible.

polycleaver.core.tools.read_bulk(bulk_str)[source]¶

Reads bulk string, converts it to pymatgen.core.Structure object.

Parameters:

bulk_str – string path of the bulk file.

polycleaver.core.tools.remove_equivalent_slabs(slablist)[source]¶

Often, the sanitizing operations performed in the ‘generate_slabs’ function converge to symmetrically equivalent slabs. This function analyses a list containing SlabUnit objects and removes equivalent slabs.

Parameters:

slablist – list of SlabUnit objects from which equivalent slabs are to be removed.

polycleaver.core.tools.set_site_attributes(structure)[source]¶

Sets the attributes of the sites present inside a structure.

Parameters:

structure – site pymatgen structure (Slab, Structure…) of which sites are to be analysed.
